title: 2000 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Tommi Mäkinen opened the new millennium with a win for Mitsubishi, navigating snowy tarmac with veteran calm.

title: 2000 Swedish Rally
bio: Marcus Grönholm claimed his first WRC win, mastering Sweden’s snowy forests and introducing himself as a title contender.

title: 2000 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Richard Burns conquered Africa’s brutal roads in his Subaru, taking a commanding win in the legendary endurance rally.

title: 2000 Rally Portugal
bio: Carlos Sainz kept Ford in the hunt with a win in Portugal, using patience and precision on unpredictable gravel.

title: 2000 Acropolis Rally (Greece)
bio: Grönholm’s Peugeot 206 survived the rock-punishing Greek roads to grab another win and extend his championship lead.

title: 2000 Rally Finland (1000 Lakes)
bio: Grönholm thrilled the home crowd with a flat-out masterclass, leaping to victory and building title momentum.

title: 2000 Rally Australia
bio: Burns answered with a clean and confident win, narrowing the gap and taking the title fight down to the final round.

title: 2000 Rally GB (United Kingdom)
bio: Marcus Grönholm sealed his first World Championship in the Welsh forests, defeating Burns and Peugeot’s rivals in style.

title: 2001 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Tommi Mäkinen took a stunning victory in Monte Carlo as rivals crashed or spun in the changing mountain conditions.

title: 2001 Swedish Rally
bio: Harri Rovanperä grabbed his first WRC win in the snow for Peugeot, showcasing their depth and speed early in the season.

title: 2001 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Richard Burns kept his title hopes alive with a smart and durable drive through Kenya's punishing terrain.

title: 2001 Rally Argentina
bio: Colin McRae bounced back with a classic win, flying through Argentina’s gravel to close the championship gap.

title: 2001 Acropolis Rally (Greece)
bio: The rough stages of Greece broke many contenders, but Peugeot’s Marcus Grönholm survived to take an important win.

title: 2001 Rally Finland
bio: McRae thrilled fans with a high-speed assault through the forests, earning back-to-back victories and a lead in the title race.

title: 2001 Rally New Zealand
bio: Burns delivered a perfect performance on smooth gravel roads, setting up a dramatic final showdown in the UK.

title: 2001 Rally GB (United Kingdom)
bio: Richard Burns clinched his first and only WRC title in front of the home crowd, capping a career-defining season with Subaru.

title: 2002 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Sébastien Loeb nearly took his first WRC win for Citroën, but a time penalty handed victory to Tommi Mäkinen instead.

title: 2002 Swedish Rally
bio: Marcus Grönholm showed strength on snow, earning a critical win early in the season with his Peugeot 206 WRC.

title: 2002 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Colin McRae took his final WRC win with a calculated and fast drive across Kenya’s brutal landscape.

title: 2002 Rally Argentina
bio: Grönholm’s dominance continued with a smooth win through South America, reinforcing his position in the points.

title: 2002 Rally Finland
bio: Grönholm crushed the Finnish gravel stages in front of his home fans, winning with blistering pace.

title: 2002 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb stunned on tarmac with a masterclass performance for Citroën, proving he was a rising force in the WRC.

title: 2002 Rally Australia
bio: Petter Solberg took his first WRC win for Subaru in a breakout performance on fast Australian gravel.

title: 2002 Rally GB (United Kingdom)
bio: Grönholm secured his second WRC title with a strong final showing in Wales, ending a dominant season for Peugeot.

title: 2003 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Loeb kicked off the season with a win for Citroën on Monte Carlo’s icy tarmac, asserting himself as a serious title contender.

title: 2003 Swedish Rally
bio: Peugeot’s Marcus Grönholm bounced back on snow, winning Sweden with classic Scandinavian control.

title: 2003 Rally of Turkey
bio: Turkey debuted on the WRC calendar, and Carlos Sainz claimed a surprise victory for Citroën on rugged, unfamiliar terrain.

title: 2003 Cyprus Rally
bio: Grönholm clawed back ground with a hot-weather win, proving Peugeot could still hang in on twisty and technical gravel.

title: 2003 Rally Finland
bio: Markko Märtin stunned in Finland, winning for Ford and proving himself one of the fastest on high-speed gravel.

title: 2003 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb dominated again on tarmac in Germany, showing off his unmatched precision on asphalt.

title: 2003 Rally Australia
bio: Petter Solberg flew to victory on the fast flowing roads of Australia, keeping his title hopes alive heading into the final rounds.

title: 2003 Wales Rally GB
bio: Petter Solberg won in dramatic fashion to clinch the WRC title for Subaru, holding off Loeb in one of the tightest finishes in WRC history.

title: 2004 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Loeb dominated the opening round with a commanding win on the icy mountain roads of Monte Carlo.

title: 2004 Rally of Sweden
bio: Petter Solberg answered back on snow, taking Subaru’s first win of the season and keeping title hopes alive.

title: 2004 Rally of Mexico
bio: In Mexico’s WRC debut, Loeb struck again, mastering the hot gravel roads with ease.

title: 2004 Cyprus Rally
bio: Loeb extended his lead with another win on the rocky stages of Cyprus, fending off Peugeot’s pursuit.

title: 2004 Rally Finland
bio: Marcus Grönholm thrilled the home crowd, flying to victory on the high-speed jumps of Finland.

title: 2004 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb’s tarmac dominance continued in Germany, taking another precise win on military roads.

title: 2004 Rally Japan
bio: Petter Solberg brought Subaru a major win in Japan’s debut, proving he was still a championship threat.

title: 2004 Wales Rally GB
bio: Loeb sealed his first WRC title in Wales, finishing second but scoring enough to become World Champion.

title: 2005 Monte Carlo Rally
bio: Loeb crushed Monte Carlo again, delivering a flawless drive and starting his title defense with dominance.

title: 2005 Swedish Rally
bio: Petter Solberg won Sweden for Subaru, breaking Loeb’s streak and showing he was still a championship contender.

title: 2005 Rally Mexico
bio: Loeb responded on Mexico’s dusty roads, delivering another calm and commanding gravel win.

title: 2005 Rally Italy (Sardinia)
bio: Marcus Grönholm took victory in Sardinia for Peugeot, capitalizing on Loeb’s rare misstep.

title: 2005 Rally of Cyprus
bio: Loeb regained control on Cyprus’s rocky gravel, beating Solberg and Grönholm in scorching heat.

title: 2005 Rally Finland
bio: Grönholm won on home turf, dominating Finland’s fast forest stages while Loeb played it safe.

title: 2005 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb’s tarmac magic continued in Germany, where he claimed yet another smooth and error-free win.

title: 2005 Wales Rally GB
bio: Loeb sealed his second WRC title early with a strategic drive in Wales, capping a near-perfect season.

title: 2006 Monte Carlo Rally
bio: Loeb opened the season in dominant fashion, mastering the icy tarmac with his new Citroën Xsara WRC.

title: 2006 Swedish Rally
bio: Marcus Grönholm stormed to victory for Ford on Sweden’s snow, showing the new Focus WRC was a real threat.

title: 2006 Rally Mexico
bio: Loeb returned to the top in Mexico, driving cleanly and consistently across dusty terrain.

title: 2006 Rally Argentina
bio: Grönholm took another win in Argentina after Loeb suffered mechanical issues in the mountains.

title: 2006 Rally Finland
bio: Grönholm soared to a home win in Finland, tightening the title fight in front of cheering fans.

title: 2006 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb dominated German tarmac again, putting on a clinic of precision through the vineyard roads.

title: 2006 Rally Japan
bio: Grönholm kept the championship alive with a victory in Japan, as Loeb watched from home with injury.

title: 2006 Wales Rally GB
bio: Despite not racing, Loeb’s points lead held. Grönholm’s win gave Ford the manufacturers’ title, but Loeb claimed his third WRC crown.

title: 2007 Monte Carlo Rally
bio: Loeb opened the season with a confident win in the debuting Citroën C4 WRC, proving it was a worthy successor.

title: 2007 Rally Sweden
bio: Ford’s Marcus Grönholm claimed a classic snow win, keeping the title race neck-and-neck early on.

title: 2007 Rally Mexico
bio: Loeb struck again in Mexico with a clean and composed drive, retaking the championship lead.

title: 2007 Rally Finland
bio: Grönholm thrilled the home crowd, flying to a spectacular victory and momentarily leading the points.

title: 2007 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb extended his tarmac dominance with a fourth straight Germany win, keeping Citroën on top.

title: 2007 Rally Japan
bio: Mikko Hirvonen emerged victorious in a chaotic rally, while Loeb and Grönholm both crashed out.

title: 2007 Rally Ireland
bio: Loeb dominated Ireland’s slippery asphalt in rainy conditions, setting up a dramatic title decider.

title: 2007 Wales Rally GB
bio: Loeb played it smart to finish third, enough to secure his fourth consecutive WRC championship in a nail-biting finale.

title: 2008 Monte Carlo Rally
bio: Loeb opened the season with a smooth and dominant win in Monte Carlo, setting the tone for another title run.

title: 2008 Rally Sweden
bio: Jari-Matti Latvala stunned the field by becoming the youngest WRC event winner in history with a win in Sweden.

title: 2008 Rally Mexico
bio: Loeb returned to form in Mexico, dominating the gravel roads with precise and commanding speed.

title: 2008 Rally Finland
bio: Hirvonen defended home soil with a clean and fast win in Finland, momentarily overtaking Loeb in points.

title: 2008 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb dominated the German tarmac yet again, claiming his seventh straight victory at the event.

title: 2008 Rally of Japan
bio: Loeb played it safe, clinching enough points to secure his fifth straight WRC drivers' championship.

title: 2008 Wales Rally GB
bio: Loeb sealed the season with another win, putting an exclamation point on one of the most dominant WRC seasons ever.

title: 2009 Rally Ireland
bio: Loeb opened the season with a tight win over Hirvonen on wet Irish tarmac, continuing his championship streak.

title: 2009 Rally Norway
bio: Hirvonen answered back on snow, winning in Norway and taking an early lead in the title fight.

title: 2009 Rally Cyprus
bio: Loeb took a commanding win on Cyprus’s slow, rough gravel, regaining momentum with the Citroën C4 WRC.

title: 2009 Rally Argentina
bio: Loeb dominated Argentina once again, winning his fourth consecutive round and pulling ahead in points.

title: 2009 Rally Finland
bio: Hirvonen thrilled the home crowd with a flawless win in Finland, keeping his championship hopes alive.

title: 2009 Rally Australia
bio: Hirvonen took advantage of Loeb’s penalties to win in Australia, setting up a nail-biting title decider.

title: 2009 Wales Rally GB
bio: Loeb won the final round after Hirvonen’s hood flipped up during a stage, clinching his sixth WRC title by just one point.
